clients.native:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://example.com/"

	payload := strings.NewReader("Hi, there")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "text/plain")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

clients.http1.1:
POST / V2Tls
Content-Type: text/plain
Host: example.com
Content-Length: 9

Hi, there

clients.okhttp:
val client = OkHttpClient()

val mediaType = MediaType.parse("text/plain")
val body = RequestBody.create(mediaType, "Hi, there")
val request = Request.Builder()
  .url("https://example.com/")
  .post(body)
  .addHeader("content-type", "text/plain")
  .build()

val response = client.newCall(request).execute()

clients.cohttp:
open Cohttp_lwt_unix
open Cohttp
open Lwt

let uri = Uri.of_string "https://example.com/" in
let headers = Header.add (Header.init ()) "content-type" "text/plain" in
let body = Cohttp_lwt_body.of_string "Hi, there" in

Client.call ~headers ~body `POST uri
>>= fun (res, body_stream) ->
  (* Do stuff with the result *)

clients.curl:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://example.com/",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "Hi, there",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "content-type: text/plain"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

clients.http1:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://example.com/');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'content-type' => 'text/plain'
]);

$request->setBody('Hi, there');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

clients.http2:
<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('Hi, there');

$request->setRequestUrl('https://example.com/');
$request->setRequestMethod('POST');
$request->setBody($body);

$request->setHeaders([
  'content-type' => 'text/plain'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

clients.python3:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("example.com")

payload = "Hi, there"

headers = { 'content-type': "text/plain" }

conn.request("POST", "/", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

clients.requests:
import requests

url = "https://example.com/"

payload = "Hi, there"
headers = {"content-type": "text/plain"}

response = requests.request("POST", url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

clients.httr:
library(httr)

url <- "https://example.com/"

payload <- "Hi, there"

encode <- "raw"

response <- VERB("POST", url, body = payload, content_type("text/plain"), encode = encode)

content(response, "text")

clients.native:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://example.com/")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["content-type"] = 'text/plain'
request.body = "Hi, there"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

clients.httpie:
echo 'Hi, there' |  \
  http POST https://example.com/ \
  content-type:text/plain
